title: Math & Physics Fundamentals Quiz 5
internal_tutorial: This is an internal tutorial. It can contain text, formulas like $E=mc^2$, and other content to help students without leaving the page.
hint: This quiz covers basic algebra and physics principles. Remember to check your formulas.

questions.text: What is the value of $x$ in the equation $2x + 3 = 11$?
questions.explanation: To solve for $x$, first subtract 3 from both sides: $2x = 11 - 3$, which simplifies to $2x = 8$. Then, divide both sides by 2 to get $x = 4$.
questions.hint: Try to isolate the variable $x$ on one side of the equation.

questions.text: What is the integral of $f(x) = x^2$?
questions.explanation: The power rule for integration states that the integral of $x^n$ is $$\frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C$$. For $x^2$, this results in $$\frac{x^3}{3} + C$$.
questions.hint: Remember the power rule for integration: $$\int x^n dx = \frac{x^{n+1}}{n+1} + C$$.

questions.text: According to Newton's Second Law, what is the formula for force?
questions.explanation: Newton's Second Law of Motion states that the force ($F$) acting on an object is equal to the mass ($m$) of the object multiplied by its acceleration ($a$).
questions.hint: This law relates force, mass, and acceleration.
